<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
 
 It seems there's a situation where a multiselect widget loses its selected values.
 <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
 
 Consider the following app:
 <denchmark-code>ab = ['a','b']
 cb = st.checkbox('cb',value=True,key='cb')
 if not cb:
     ms1 = st.multiselect('ms1',ab,default=ab,key='ms1')
 ms2 = st.multiselect('ms2',ab,default=ab,key='ms2')
 </denchmark-code>
 
 
 Click on 'b' in ms2 (this will select only 'a')
 Click on the checkbox (this will display ms1 before ms2)
 
 <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
 
 I would expect ms2 displaying only 'a' as preselected value.
 <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
 
 ms2 displays 'a' and 'b' as it was rendered for the first time
 <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
 
 don't know
 <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
 
 
 Streamlit version: 0.54.0
 Python version: 3.6.8
